title: 820-00928-A short on PPBUS_G3H
message:
Hi guys,

I have an 820-00928-A with a 0.5R short to ground on PPBUS_G3H.I removed F7000 and F7001, the short is on the pin2 side. I injected voltage into the pad of where pin2 of F7000 goes and wound up the voltage. It was drawing ~4A at 1.8V and the only thing warming up is the CPU. I'm nervous to turn the voltage up higher than that, does anyone have any tips or advice on what to try next?

I was thinking about removing the current sense resistors R7210 and so on to take the CPU out of the equation. Any help would be appreciated.

BTW, I found that the schematic and boardview for 820-00281 is close enough to use as the schematic and bv aren't available for this model.

Cheers,

Alex

title: 820-00928-A short on PPBUS_G3H
message: Please let me know if I left out some important info.

title: 820-00928-A short on PPBUS_G3H
message: Shorted FET is the CPU power supply. The CPU has already died, RIP.
